explanations.machine learning: The paper compares the performance of the FINBERT model with baseline machine learning classifiers like naive bayes and SVM.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper involves training models to predict stock market movements, which is a supervised learning task.
explanations.classification: The models are used to classify sentiment and predict stock market movements, which are classification tasks.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper mentions SVM as one of the baseline machine learning classifiers used for comparison.
explanations.SVM: Abbreviation for support vector machine, mentioned as a baseline classifier.
explanations.neural network: The paper develops deep neural network models (FINBERT) for stock market prediction.
explanations.deep learning: The paper uses deep learning techniques, specifically FINBERT models, for understanding the market and its future direction.
explanations.representation learning: FINBERT models are pre-trained on financial phrase datasets, which involves learning representations of financial text.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper compares the accuracy of the FINBERT model with LSTM.
explanations.LSTM: Abbreviation for long short-term memory, mentioned as a comparison model.
explanations.Large Language Model: FINBERT is a type of large language model pre-trained on financial data.
explanations.LLM: Abbreviation for Large Language Model, as FINBERT is an example of such a model.
